Tucson grits his teeth and bares the pain inflicted on him.  He was not abo=
ut to give up now, not when Rodimus really needed him.  He remembered how V=
estige had been invigorated by his transfer of power from his chest core, w=
here a beating heart still pulsates.  It would prove useful again, and this=
 time, he needed a way to channel that power into the figure lying on the b=
ed.  He uses his arm to shield away the insects who were stinging him.  Wit=
h the other arm, he reaches out to the figure's chest, and puts his hand on=
 him gently.  He concentrates deeply and tries to channel his own spiritual=
ity into the figure lying on the bed.  His very soul now acting upon his he=
art out of the one power that no force could fight.  The power of compassio=
n, of love, and of loyalty.  

" Rodimus, I'm here now, and there is nothin=
g that will stop me from bringing you back. My hand is here for you now.  A=
nd this time, I will never let go."

wiftly

y are far more agile in the air than he is.

the bed, almost in the position that the

ginally. The figure still laying prone

 almost completely white with hints

omehow drained away, leaving it

its most striking feature was

s

end off some with his blade, he cannot stop all of them from scoring

im!
